page.title: 14Wortley Hall
page.content: Wortley Hall was the home of the Wortley family. The present building dates back to 1757 but there has been a hall on the same site since 1580. It is a beautiful building set in the middle of parkland. The main entrance is in the village. In 1950 the family left the hall and moved to another house on the estate. Now the hall is a place where people stay for holidays. They are usually retired miners and their families from Durham. They enjoy the countryside. The hall is also used for conferences and by the villagers for parties. Part of the parkland is used as a golf course. It is a very popular place and several famous people have played there. The gamekeeper lives in the wood nearby. He rears partridges and pheasants. A TV film was made about his work.
